div.ab: Alabaster calcined in a crucible over charcoal fire, so that, touching it, it turns into powder. Once cold, pulverize it finely & pass it through a double sieve & render it as if impalpable. And d with one lb of alabaster, one needs one â„¥ of sal ammoniac. Mix well & incorporate everything together, then put them in a cellar cellar or a humid place. And with this paste, mold what you will need, & next dry the mold in the fire, & cast whichever metal you wish, while the sand is hot; & you will cast as neatly as the principal, & the sand can still be used by placing it in a humid place & drying it in the fire.
